intro: Trichaurus, commonly known as the common thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and produces striking violet or blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its fruit, a fleshy, orange-red berry, contains seeds that are dispersed by animals. Trichaurus is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
